content:
• Friday, September 7, 2012
  • CPRI

    Michael Kors (KORS) -4.7% AH after announcing insiders plan to sell 20M shares (10.3% of...

    Michael Kors (KORS) -4.7% AH after announcing insiders plan to sell 20M shares (10.3% of outstanding shares) through a secondary offering. The high-end apparel retailer, which made new highs today, already saw its IPO lockup expire in June. (PR) (Wednesday)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • ALSN

    Shares of Allison Transmission (ALSN +5.6%) finish the day higher ahead of the expiration of its...

    Shares of Allison Transmission (ALSN +5.6%) finish the day higher ahead of the expiration of its lockup totaling 181.4 million shares. The company's 26.1M share IPO rolled out in March with an initial price of $23 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • DWDP

    In a tax decision with broad impact for manufacturers, the U.S. 2nd Circuit Court of Appeals...

    In a tax decision with broad impact for manufacturers, the U.S. 2nd Circuit Court of Appeals rules Dow Chemical (DOW +2.5%) could not retroactively claim R&D tax credits for improving how it made an existing product. Only $8M of R&D claims were at issue, but tax pros say the case was a key test of how broadly companies can claim the tax credit.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • RS

    Metals USA (MUSA +4%) gains after Deutsche initiates coverage with a Buy and a price target of...

    Metals USA (MUSA +4%) gains after Deutsche initiates coverage with a Buy and a price target of $21 per share. Deutsche notes that steel equities have been weak this year, declining 22% YTD and under performing the S&P by 33%. MUSA however, has out-performed both its peers and the S&P this year. The stock has been hit recently, since its largest shareholder Apollo sold a 10% stake in early August. The firm sees the weakness as a buying opportunity.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • TRN

    Trinity Industries (TRN +4.5%) gains after saying its purchased certain property, plant and...

    Trinity Industries (TRN +4.5%) gains after saying its purchased certain property, plant and equipment of DMI Industries from Otter Tail Corporation for approximately $20M. The assets consist primarily of approximately 665K square feet of heavy manufacturing capacity and equipment located in North Dakota, Oklahoma, and Ontario, Canada.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • MPC

    Marathon Petroleum (MPC +1.8%) begins shutting down its refinery in Detroit as part of the final...

    Marathon Petroleum (MPC +1.8%) begins shutting down its refinery in Detroit as part of the final step of its four-year project to increase capacity to 120K bbl/day and boost its ability to process heavier types of crude, including those from western Canada. The shutdown is expected to last 70 days.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • HES

    Hess (HES +4.1%) continues its spate of asset sales, agreeing to sell its 2.72% interest in the...

    Hess (HES +4.1%) continues its spate of asset sales, agreeing to sell its 2.72% interest in the Azeri, Chirag and Guneshli Fields in Azerbaijan and its 2.36% interest in the associated BTC pipeline to India's ONGC Videsh for $1B. The sale, expected to close in Q1 2013, is subject to Indian and other government and regulatory approvals.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM

  • Shares of Coffee Holding (JVA +20.0%) roar higher to reach their highest level since June. A...

    Shares of Coffee Holding (JVA +20.0%) roar higher to reach their highest level since June. A little analyst love for peer Green Mountain Coffee Roasters was enough to jumpstart the stock back to life.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • TECK

    Teck Resources (TCK +9.7%) enjoys a boost from surging copper prices and despite a downgrade...

    Teck Resources (TCK +9.7%) enjoys a boost from surging copper prices and despite a downgrade from Dahlman Rose. The firm lowers its outlook on metallurgical coal due to slowing global growth, particularly in China, and expects limited upside for met-exposed names like Teck as supply-demand conditions play through until H1 of next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • NEPT

    Neptune Technologies & Bioressources (NEPT +4.6%) moves up after its board approves...

    Neptune Technologies & Bioressources (NEPT +4.6%) moves up after its board approves dividend-in-kind distribution and a record date for a partial spin-off of its NeuroBioPharm business. 2M shares will be allotted to shareholders of record as of October 15. Each unit will consist of one class A subordinate voting share of NeuroBio and two warrants.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • NOK

    European tech and telecom stocks carrying heavy debt loads are jumping today on optimism...

    European tech and telecom stocks carrying heavy debt loads are jumping today on optimism regarding the ECB's latest efforts to prop up Europe's bond markets. NOK +6.1%. ALU +4.5%. TI +7.8%. TEF +3.6%. Many Asian tech names are also posting solid gains, after the continent's stock markets rallied overnight in the wake of a new Chinese stimulus plan. YOKU +4.8%. SPRD +4.7%. SNE +3.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 3 Comments
  • BHGE

    The U.S. natural gas rig count continues its steady slide, shedding another 21 rigs last week to...

    The U.S. natural gas rig count continues its steady slide, shedding another 21 rigs last week to 452, down from 892 a year ago, Baker Hughes (BHI +2.4%) reports. The U.S. oil rig count also fell, down 10 to 1,409 but way up from 1,057 a year ago. Canada's total for both oil and gas rigs rose in the past week but are down significantly Y/Y.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • TNGO

    Tangoe (OTC:TNGO -12.3%) crumbles for the second day in a row (previous) due to a critical...

    Tangoe (OTC:TNGO -12.3%) crumbles for the second day in a row (previous) due to a critical report from Copperfield Research that questioned the company's growth rate and management's ethics. Shares are now down 30% since Aug. 28, when The Street Sweeper, which just closed its short position, issued a harsh report of its own.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • ADNC

    Pandora can take comfort in the fact it's not Audience (ADNC -65.9%). The call-processing...

    Pandora can take comfort in the fact it's not Audience (ADNC -65.9%). The call-processing chip/technology developer has shed almost 2/3 of its value after disclosing its tech won't be used in the next iPhone. As you'd expect, downgrades are pouring in: while Credit Suisse is only cutting its 2013 revenue forecast by 9%, it's slashing its EPS forecast by 75%, since Apple's royalties (unlike chip sales) are almost pure profit. Sterne Agee thinks Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS) could benefit from Audience's woes.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • CYTX

    Shares of Cytori Therapeutics (CYTX +3.5%) trade up after Maxim Group initiates coverage with a...

    Shares of Cytori Therapeutics (CYTX +3.5%) trade up after Maxim Group initiates coverage with a Buy and a $10 price target. CYTX is a stem-cell research firm focused on developing a therapeutic platform that harnesses the power of regenerative cells to treat and cure a multitude of human afflictions using a razor/razor blade model.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • SYSW

    Syswin (SYSW +18.1%) CEO Liangsheng Chen offers a going-private deal for the nearly 60% of the...

    Syswin (SYSW +18.1%) CEO Liangsheng Chen offers a going-private deal for the nearly 60% of the Chinese real estate company he doesn't already own. Chen's offer is for $0.50/share plus $2/ADS share (each ADS represents four ordinary shares), equaling a 25% premium to yesterday's closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • ACER

    Opexa Therapeutics (OPXA +3.2%) trades up today after signing a sales agreement with Brinson...

    Opexa Therapeutics (OPXA +3.2%) trades up today after signing a sales agreement with Brinson Patrick Securities, under which the company may sell shares of its common stock, with Brinson Patrick Securities as its sales agent on a 3% commission.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • STP

    Suntech (STP -7.4%) dives after announcing sales chief Andrew Beebe has resigned for "personal...

    Suntech (STP -7.4%) dives after announcing sales chief Andrew Beebe has resigned for "personal reasons," and that the company doesn't intend to hire a replacement (regional heads will now report directly to CEO David King). Beebe's departure comes 3 weeks after chairman Zhengrong Shi resigned as CEO in response to revelations the solar module firm may have been defrauded of $662M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • AA

    Alcoa (AA +2.6%) says it has no new potential buyers for its Sardinian smelter. The Italian...

    Alcoa (AA +2.6%) says it has no new potential buyers for its Sardinian smelter. The Italian government had said Glencore was mulling taking it over, but the company hasn't received any concrete expressions of interest.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG +4.9%) pops in response to a column from SA's Icarus Falling. The author is...

    Vringo (VRNG +4.9%) pops in response to a column from SA's Icarus Falling. The author is skeptical of arguments Google could get a summary judgment that would dismiss Vringo's suit against the search giant on account of prior art. Though a trial is scheduled to start on Oct. 15, Google still hasn't requested a summary judgment, and a Feb. 15 scheduling order suggests the district court handling the case isn't inclined to grant one.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +41.7%) soars after it says interim results Phase II trials show...

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +41.7%) soars after it says interim results Phase II trials show the combined use of its bavituximab drug candidate with chemotherapy drug docetaxel had a statistically significant improvement in the overall survival rate for lung cancer patients.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 8 Comments
  • MRGE

    Merge Healthcare (MRGE -4.2%) slips after announcing that its Board has hired Allen &...

    Merge Healthcare (MRGE -4.2%) slips after announcing that its Board has hired Allen & Company to assist in exploring and evaluating a broad range of strategic alternatives , including a sale. Additionally, Dougherty cuts the shares to Neutral, saying its fundamentals are weakening and it's going to be difficult to determine a value for the company, much less predict the probability of any sale at all.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • CNX

    Dahlman Rose raises its price target for Consol Energy (CNX +6.6%) to $38 from $35, recognizing...

    Dahlman Rose raises its price target for Consol Energy (CNX +6.6%) to $38 from $35, recognizing increased value in CNX's E&P business, particularly Utica Shale assets. The firm is more positive on gas operations with stabilization in the natural gas markets over the past few months and impressive results surfacing in the Southern Utica.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • MT

    The steel industry remains burdened with chronic structural overcapacity that will take at least...

    The steel industry remains burdened with chronic structural overcapacity that will take at least seven years to eliminate, Credit Suisse says, but demand looks to be at the low end of the cycle, suggesting an upturn in the steel market is likely by 2013 or 2014. In such an environment, the firm favors MT, RS, NUE, PKX, TX.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • BHP

    S&P warns the buffer around BHP Billiton's (BHP +3.7%) single-A credit rating has diminished...

    S&P warns the buffer around BHP Billiton's (BHP +3.7%) single-A credit rating has diminished with the slump in commodity prices, although it affirms its rating and says the outlook remains stable. "We believe BHP Billiton, compared to its peers, has the best asset diversity and is the most financially flexible to respond to weakening commodity prices," S&P says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL +0.6%), Google (GOOG +1.3%), and Amazon (AMZN +2.8%) have two things in common: 1)...

    Apple (AAPL +0.6%), Google (GOOG +1.3%), and Amazon (AMZN +2.8%) have two things in common: 1) They're at each others' throats. 2) They're making new highs today, rising even as PC-centric names fall on Intel's warning. Amazon's gains come as the Street mostly gives a thumbs-up to its Kindle refresh, citing its potential to boost Amazon's content ecosystem. Henry Blodget is taking a moment to gloat about his infamous 1998 $400 target (now a split-adjusted $67). (more on AMZN)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 5 Comments
  • DDMGQ

    Digital Domain (DDMG -5.3%), crushed on Wednesday after defaulting on its debt, is unveiling a...

    Digital Domain (DDMG -5.3%), crushed on Wednesday after defaulting on its debt, is unveiling a major restructuring. Chairman/CEO John Textor has resigned from all positions with the company, and DDMG plans to shut down its Port St. Lucie, FL special-effects studio, which only in June got a very favorable newspaper write-up. The company's California and Vancouver studios will keep running.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 5 Comments

  • Shares of Quiksilver (ZQK +20.9%) soar after the company tops profit estimates with its Q3...

    Shares of Quiksilver (ZQK +20.9%) soar after the company tops profit estimates with its Q3 results. On a conference call, execs note brand penetration and improved e-commerce sales helped drive sales. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • MNK

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR +3.7%) reports significantly higher prescription growth in August...

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR +3.7%) reports significantly higher prescription growth in August for its lead product, Acthar Gel. The company says that during the period, it shipped a total of 2,190 vials of Acthar to CuraScript SD, an increase of 33% M/M. Jefferies says the prescription data was strong and that the company will likely beat the Q3 consensus revenue estimate. The firm reiterates a Buy with a $60 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Metal and mining firms are among today's top gainers on China's plans to spend $156B on...

    Metal and mining firms are among today's top gainers on China's plans to spend $156B on infrastructure and Glencore's raised buyout offer for Xstrata. Coal is enjoying a big day, with Alpha Natural (ANR +14%) the S&P's biggest advancer. Other coal (KOL +5.2%) names: CLF +11%, BTU +9.6%. Steel (SLX +5%) names: X +7.1%, AKS +9.1%. Also: FCX +6.9%, JOY +6.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 1 Comment
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (MLNX -6.8%) slides after Stifel downgrades to Hold. This year's huge run-up probably...

    Mellanox (MLNX -6.8%) slides after Stifel downgrades to Hold. This year's huge run-up probably has something to do with Stifel's move. Mellanox has been one of the year's best performers, thanks to huge earnings beats fueled by soaring sales of the company's InfiniBand adapter cards to Oracle for use in the latter's high-end "engineered" systems.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM

  • How much is enough? Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW +10.3%) continue to ride M&A chatter to new...

    How much is enough? Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW +10.3%) continue to ride M&A chatter to new heights, with the 26% rally over the last week showing no signs of slowing down. What we know: The firm has hired advisors and big names such as Microsoft and Oracle are reportedly sniffing around. What we don't know: How snapping up the company will add synergies for the buyer worth the ~$1B price tag.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • SYNC

    Synacor (SYNC +2.7%) trades higher BofA upgrades to Buy, albeit while maintaining its $11...

    Synacor (SYNC +2.7%) trades higher BofA upgrades to Buy, albeit while maintaining its $11 target. The upgrade is valuation-based - Synacor has fallen sharply after getting bid up thanks to Jonathan Lebed's promotional work, and BofA thinks a 9x estimated 2013 EV/EBITDA ratio is reasonable. Today's gains come even though Envivio, another TV Everywhere play, is diving thanks to a poor earnings report. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • JKS

    JinkoSolar (JKS +3%) responds to the initiation of anti-dumping investigation by the European...

    JinkoSolar (JKS +3%) responds to the initiation of anti-dumping investigation by the European Commission: Anti-dumping allegations are "unfair and unfounded, and do not reflect the reality of the highly-competitive global solar industry." JKS "will continue expanding into emerging markets... to alleviate possible impacts that could result from the potential trade friction."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • GMCR

    It's full speed ahead for Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +11.3%) as a pair of analyst...

    It's full speed ahead for Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +11.3%) as a pair of analyst notes fire up a healthy round of momentum trading. Roth Capital notes the firm's looming patent expirations are already baked into GMCR's share price, while Lazard Capital initiates shares at Buy with its own positive take. As expected, the GMCR doubters are out in full force over the burgeoning rally.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 3 Comments
  • SRPT

    Sarepta Pharmaceuticals (SRPT -5.3%) continues its decline today on the back of news earlier...

    Sarepta Pharmaceuticals (SRPT -5.3%) continues its decline today on the back of news earlier this week that it had entered into an at-the-market equity offering sales agreement with Citadel Securities. It's all relative however, when you consider that the stock has been on a tear recently, gaining over 300% just since mid-July after releasing its 36-week data from their current phase IIb extension study of Eteplirsen, its potential treatment for Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • WRK

    Rock-Tenn (RKT +2.7%) is upgraded to Conviction Buy from Neutral at Goldman Sachs, with an $83...

    Rock-Tenn (RKT +2.7%) is upgraded to Conviction Buy from Neutral at Goldman Sachs, with an $83 price target raised from $56, citing leverage to higher containerboard prices. The firm says its channel checks suggest producers are showing strong resolve to push through the announced $50/ton price hike, which it says is gaining traction in the market.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • PHYS

    The Sprott Physical Gold Trust (NYSEARCA:PHYS) remains halted after pricing its 23M unit...

    The Sprott Physical Gold Trust (NYSEARCA:PHYS) remains halted after pricing its 23M unit secondary at $14.84/share. The $341M in proceeds will, of course, be used to buy bullion. Yesterday's closing price was $15.06. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • BLOX

    2012 IPOs Infoblox (BLOX -14.2%) and Envivio (ENVI -17.4%) get crushed after posting...

    2012 IPOs Infoblox (BLOX -14.2%) and Envivio (ENVI -17.4%) get crushed after posting disappointing earnings reports (I, II). While Infoblox's FQ4 results were decent, the network management software firm's mixed FY13 guidance (revenue of $195M-$202M and EPS of $0.04-$0.07 vs. consensus of $194.8M and EPS of $0.11) isn't going over well. Envivio, meanwhile, both missed FQ2 EPS forecasts and guided for FQ3 results below already-depressed Street estimates. (ENVI warning)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • INTC

    Intel's (INTC -2.8%) warning is hurting other chip stocks with strong PC exposure: AMD -3.4%....

    Intel's (INTC -2.8%) warning is hurting other chip stocks with strong PC exposure: AMD -3.4%. NVDA -4.5%. MU -4.6%. H-P (HPQ -1.4%), Microsoft (MSFT -1.3%), Seagate (STX -1.6%), and Western Digital (WDC -1.4%) are off moderately, though Dell (DELL-OLD +0.9%) is higher after declaring its first dividend. Analysts had been slashing estimates (I, II, III) for Intel ahead of the warning thanks to a torrent of negative PC data - that seems to be limiting the damage.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM | 4 Comments

  • We'll ask the question again - has oil topped out? Isaac and the ECB couldn't get oil to extend...

    We'll ask the question again - has oil topped out? Isaac and the ECB couldn't get oil to extend its rally. Now Beijing and the Fed enter the picture and WTI crude falls 1.3% to $94.33 even as other stimulus-sensitive commodities get lit up bright green. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 2 Comments

  • Shares of Chipotle (CMG +4.2%) run higher with call options showing a healthy boost in volume....

    Shares of Chipotle (CMG +4.2%) run higher with call options showing a healthy boost in volume. Traders say the momentum name is back in favor after seeing 33% lopped off its price from the April high.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM

  • Gold hits its highest level since February, +1.4% to $1,731 as QE expectations for next week...

    Gold hits its highest level since February, +1.4% to $1,731 as QE expectations for next week ratchet up following the payroll report. Silver and copper follow suit, both posting large gains and multi-month highs. And don't forget Beijing - now getting serious about its own stimulus efforts.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 8 Comments
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +6.8%) bursts higher at the open after the United Steelworkers of...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +6.8%) bursts higher at the open after the United Steelworkers of America says the union agreed to continue working beyond a Sept. 1 contract deadline and return to the bargaining table on Oct. 8. At U.S. Steel (NYSE:X), labor talks earlier this week resulted in a temporary three-year contract; talks continue at ArcelorMittal (NYSE:MT).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • OI

    Owens-Illinois (OI +2.1%) extends yesterday's gains as activist investor Alexander...

    Owens-Illinois (OI +2.1%) extends yesterday's gains as activist investor Alexander Roepers’ Atlantic Investment Management raises its stake in the glass container company and says it will continue active discussions with management on actions to increase shareholder value, according to an SEC filing.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • MFRM

    Mattress stocks are on watch for a shakeup after Mattress Firm clipped its estimates for FY13...

    Mattress stocks are on watch for a shakeup after Mattress Firm clipped its estimates for FY13 earnings. Organic sales in the sector are now in focus with investors as companies start to run out of ways to buy growth. Premarket: MFRM -10.1%, SCS -1.3%, TPX -1.5%, ZZ inactive.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM
  • P

    Pandora (NYSE:P) now -16.9% in response to the WSJ's report (I, II) on Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL)...

    Pandora (NYSE:P) now -16.9% in response to the WSJ's report (I, II) on Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) Internet radio ambitions. Pandora has thus far been successful in weathering challenges from Clear Channel, Spotify, and others, in part because of the time invested by its users in building custom stations. But a service that comes pre-installed on iOS devices, features tight iTunes integration, and is backed by Apple's brand and marketing machine would present a different kind of competition.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 17 Comments
  • AOBC

    Premarket gainers: SWHC +22%. ULTA +9%. QCOR +9%. DB +7%. ROSG-OLD +7%. BCS +6%. CS +6%. VICL...

    Premarket gainers: SWHC +22%. ULTA +9%. QCOR +9%. DB +7%. ROSG-OLD +7%. BCS +6%. CS +6%. VICL +5%. CTIC +5%.
    Losers: ADNC -59%. P -17%. MFRM -10%. FDUS -6%. PVG -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • PTEN

    Patterson-UTI Energy (NASDAQ:PTEN) +2.3% premarket after BMO Capital raises its rating...

    Patterson-UTIEnergy (NASDAQ:PTEN) +2.3% premarket after BMOCapital raises its rating on the stock two notches to Outperform with a $20 price target, up from $15. The land drilling contractor reports an average of 215 rigs operating during August, including 210 rigs in the U.S. and five in Canada.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM
  • LUV

    Southwest Airlines (NYSE:LUV) reports air traffic for August with the carrier improving its load...

    Southwest Airlines (NYSE:LUV) reports air traffic for August with the carrier improving its load factor on flat revenue passenger miles. Key metric, passenger revenue per ASM, is estimated to have improved by 2%-3% during the month. Shares of LUV +1.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM
  • KR

    Kroger (NYSE:KR): Q2 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $21.7B (+3.9% Y/Y) misses by $200M....

    Kroger (NYSE:KR): Q2 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $21.7B (+3.9% Y/Y) misses by $200M. Shares +2.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM
  • AOBC

    Execs with Smith & Wesson (SWHC) say the demand for guns isn't going away despite the direction...

    Execs with Smith & Wesson (SWHC) say the demand for guns isn't going away despite the direction the national election goes. Though the Q/Q pace of sales was quite dramatic with modern sporting rifles up 144% and handguns 26.4% higher, the trend for long-term growth also remains intact. SWHC +20.5% premarket. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM
  • UTX

    United Technologies (NYSE:UTX) sticks with its 2012 outlook, affirming EPS of $5.25-5.35 vs....

    United Technologies (NYSE:UTX) sticks with its 2012 outlook, affirming EPS of $5.25-5.35 vs. $5.32 consensus estimate, and revenue of $58B-$59B vs $58.6B consensus. UTX also expects to pay down about one-third of debt issued for its acquisition of Goodrich by year's end. UTX +1.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM
  • BIOF

    Tiny BioFuel Energy (NASDAQ:BIOF) has attracted the attention of two top hedge funders: David...

    Tiny BioFuel Energy (NASDAQ:BIOF) has attracted the attention of two top hedge funders: David Einhorn’s Greenlight Capital just bought 69K shares to increase its holdings to more than 36% of the company, and Daniel Loeb’s Third Point recently purchased 34K additional shares to raise its stake to nearly 19%. BIOF +5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:21 AM
  • INTC

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) -2.3% premarket after issuing downside guidance for Q3, lowering projected...

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) -2.3% premarket after issuing downside guidance for Q3, lowering projected revenues ~7% to $12.9B-$13.5B from $13.8B-$14.8B due to "weaker than expected demand in a challenging macroeconomic environment." INTC sees customers reducing supply chain inventory, softness in the enterprise PC market segment, and slowing emerging market demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM | 13 Comments
  • BRC

    Brady (NYSE:BRC): FQ4 EPS of $0.47 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $322.5M (-6% Y/Y) misses by $5M....

    Brady (NYSE:BRC): FQ4 EPS of $0.47 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $322.5M (-6% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares -10.9% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM
  • LULU

    An earning beat and a hike in guidance from Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) isn't enough to overshadow a...

    An earning beat and a hike in guidance from Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) isn't enough to overshadow a sharp increase in its inventory total as investors sell off shares. With same-store sales still growing at a double-digit pace, Kid Dynamite wants to know why building up inventory doesn't make sense for the retailer into Q4. LULU -1.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM | 2 Comments
  • STI

    SunTrust's (NYSE:STI) sale of its Coca-Cola stake and attempt to clarify its mortgage repurchase...

    SunTrust's (NYSE:STI) sale of its Coca-Cola stake and attempt to clarify its mortgage repurchase obligations has the analysts chattering. BMO Capital says the actions merit an upgrade and raising of price target to $35 from $26. Jefferies maintains its Buy rating and raises the price target to $29 from $28. Shares +1.2% premarket.

    Not only do EU stocks continue climbing over the ECB's bond-purchase scheme, but Spanish and Italian bond markets are dancing with delight as well. Spain 10-year yield -34 bps to 5.72%, 3-year -29 bps to 3.36%. Italy 10-year -14 bps to 5.05%, 3-year -12 bps to 2.7%.

  • EU shares continue where they left off yesterday, solidly higher after Mario Draghi outlines the...

    EU shares continue where they left off yesterday, solidly higher after Mario Draghi outlines the ECB's bond-buying program. China's plans for infrastructure spending and surprisingly nice German trade figures must surely be helping too, although below-par U.S. payroll data later could burst the mood. EU Stoxx 50 +1.45%, London +0.4%, Paris +1.2%, Frankfurt +0.9%, Madrid +1.6%, Milan +1.8%.
